column5: Howdy Kids.....  Does anyone know what types of fish species are in the pond?  Thanks for any info.....  Meely
Interested to see the answer to this question considering I live in tottenham. I heard there're bass and The odd spec
E-Mail here is the contact info for the park, might have been just as easy for you to send them an e-mail as it was to post here.  jjcanoe
Just to follow-up JJC.... I did email the park and am still waiting for a reply. Thanks for your reply though.....I'm now 2 cents closer to a response.  Meely

bass, sunfish, perch They used to stock the pond every year with rainbows, so i would imagine there would be some in there still.  Blows my mind that people camp there all summer long, city folk think it is the north and in the bush lol.  I grew up there. Not a bad spot but not my ideal place to put an rv for the summer lol

Blows my mind that people camp there all summer long, city folk think it is the north and in the bush lol. Im born and raised downtown Toronto. and I defiantly dont consider anything south of Parry Sound 'up  north'. so youz a wrong

Thanks for the replies......  I was just looking for a place where I could get to for a few hours in the summer evenings after I get home from work or for those weekends when I cant get away up north to the "real" outdoors.  This place is not that far from me and if there are bass in the lake....I think I'll give it a whirl.  Thanks for the info.......  Meely
I know a really good bass spot in this area. Pm me and Mabey we can get out there one Sunday ??
If you live around there you also have orangeville reservoir and the holland canals are loaded with fun sized panfish and bass.
